medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three days prior to presentation following the ingestion of fast food, manifesting as multiple loose, watery bowel movements, abdominal pain in the left lower quadrant (LLQ) greater than right lower quadrant (RLQ), nausea, and non-bloody, non-bilious vomiting. The abdominal pain has increased in severity. The patient has not passed flatus and has had minimal oral intake for three days, experiencing lightheadedness with ambulation.
